description: Dive into "Sun-Kissed Shores of Miyakojima" — a handpicked list of places with quick notes, links, and essentials for fast trip planning and discovery.
title: Sun-Kissed Shores of Miyakojima

places.generalDescription: Aragusuku Beach is a serene ocean retreat located on the eastern part of Miyako Island. Unlike other beaches in the area, it is sheltered from strong waves and wind, making it ideal for families and adventurous travelers alike. The beach boasts clear shallow waters with vibrant coral reefs and tropical fish, perfect for snorkeling. With its expansive sandy shores, Aragusuku Beach offers a relaxing environment for strolling and enjoying the tranquil surroundings.

sources.snippet: Aragusuku Beach Differing once more from the others in this list, Aragasuku beach is on the east of the island, and as such is often sheltered from larger waves and wind. It stays shallow for a long time, has very few rocks, and many kilometres of sand to stroll along. It is great for families with the shallow, sheltered water, or the more adventurous traveller as there are various water crafts available for rent on the beach front.
sources.shortName: 5 best beaches on Miyako-jima, Japan

sources.snippet: Differing once more from the others in this list, Aragasuku beach is on the east of the island, and as such is often sheltered from larger waves and wind. It stays shallow for a long time, has very few rocks, and many kilometres of sand to stroll along. It is great for families with the shallow, sheltered water, or the more adventurous traveller as there are various water crafts available for rent on the beach front.
sources.shortName: The best beaches in Japan

sources.snippet: Aragasuku Beach once again stands out from the others in this List and is located in the east of the island and is therefore often protected from large waves and wind. It stays flat for a long time, has very few rocks and many kilometers of sand to walk around. It is ideal for families with shallow and protected waters or for adventurous travelers, as it is possible to rent different boats on the beach.
sources.shortName: Gorgeous Beaches in Miyako-jima,Japan

sources.snippet: Another beach that is protected from the larger waves due to its geography is Aragusuku Beach. There is a very large area of shallow reef where you can safely snorkel and swim, and it is dotted with large coral rocks with white sand in between. It’s a delight just to snorkel leisurely through the area to discover all the sea life that lives around the coral rocks.
sources.shortName: The 5 best places to go in Miyakojima

sources.snippet: Beach hopping tours allow you to visit several of Miyako Island's beautiful beaches in a single day. Each beach offers a unique experience, from the bustling Yonaha Maehama Beach to the serene Aragusuku Beach. These tours provide a comprehensive way to explore the island's diverse coastal landscapes.
sources.shortName: Miyako Island Beaches: Marine Adventures Await

sources.snippet: Aragusuku beach is located on the eastern tip of Miyako island. The beach is faced north-northeast and like the Yoshino coast it is protected by a coral reef, shielding it from big waves. At high tide it is a great place for beginners to snorkel, as there are plenty of coral and fish on low water.
sources.shortName: Beaches of Miyakojima (comprehensive list)

sources.snippet: Located on Miyakojima’s eastern coast, Aragusuku Beach (Map) is the perfect spot for snorkeling and sunbathing. Colorful sea life can be seen swimming in the beach’s clear aquamarine waters. If you’re lucky, you might even spot a sea turtle while snorkeling.
sources.shortName: Miyakojima - GaijinPot Travel

sources.snippet: For snorkeling on Miyako-jima Island, Aragusuku Beach on the west is recommended. If you don’t have the necessary equipment, rental shops are around the shore. Compared to Yoshino Kaigan Beach (吉野海岸), you can expect fewer crowds at Aragusuku Beach.
sources.siteName: Vegetarian's Japan Guide | Ultimate Japan Guide, Vegetarian-Friendly, Hidden Gems in Japan
sources.shortName: The Complete Guide to the Beaches on Miyako-jima Island 2025

sources.snippet: If you want to go snorkeling, Aragusuku Beach would be your best bet. For spotting turtles, Yoshino Beach is the place to go. Please respect the turtles’ space, as they are very sensitive animals.
sources.shortName: Miyakojima Island | Okinawa Travel Guide

sources.snippet: Located on the east side of Miyako island is Aragusuku beach. It is a perfect snorkel spot for children and adults. The sea is shallow there and you can see a variety of coral and tropical fish.
sources.shortName: Miyakojima! Recommended beach spots and surrounding islands. | GOOD LUCK TRIP

places.name: Aragusuku Beach

reviews.text:
Excellent place for scuba diving
Will need to arrive no later than 7:00 am in order to have parking space.
There are beach umbrellas with chairs and a table for 2000yen
1000yen for parking
Plenty of fish and Coral
There is also a small number of turtles
Will definitely come again

Probably the most perfect place to snorkel!! In a very shallow area, a lot of fishes and even sea turtle are moving around so that anyone having equipement could easily enjoy the oceanic beauty. Unbelievable how can all these species can live in this shallow water, this close to the shore.

Aragusuku Beach isn't the most stunning beach in Miyakojima, but it definitely has its own charm - especially if you're hoping to see sea turtles. I was lucky enough to spot three swimming together while snorkeling! (Sadly, I only have GoPro footage, no pics.) I also saw a huge pufferfish.

Parking isn't free, but it's organized, and you can also rent a table, chairs, and an umbrella at a reasonable price. I rented a life vest from a friendly guy in the parking lot - he also shared some great tips about other beaches around the island, which was super helpful.

There are snacks available right by the beach, including Okinawa soba. We tried the hot dogs, and they were surprisingly good and affordable. Overall, a relaxing place with a unique wildlife experience. Worth a visit if you're on Miyakojima, especially if you're into snorkeling.

places.address: 新城, Aragusuku-字 Gusukube, Miyakojima, Okinawa 906-0102, Japan

places.generalDescription: Yonaha Beach, also known as Yonaha Maehama Beach, is a picturesque white-sand shoreline on Miyako Island. It stretches for about 7 kilometers and offers a serene environment for relaxation and swimming. The beach is well-equipped with amenities such as a cafe, water sports rentals, parking lot, showers, and toilets. Its expansive coastline allows visitors to find their own space away from the crowds and enjoy activities like wind sports.

sources.snippet: Yonaha Beach Perhaps a more conventional style of beach, this wide sand strip extends for kilometres on end, enabling groups or individuals to find their own space away from others and settle in for a half day or so. As this stretch of coast line is more exposed, it can be windier and experience higher waves, so it is well suited to wind sports and older families/groups. The car park is a few meters from the beach itself, so access is easy for most people and you can make several trips if you’re brining a lot of beach toys with you.
sources.shortName: 5 best beaches on Miyako-jima, Japan

sources.snippet: Perhaps a more conventional style of beach, this wide sand strip extends for kilometres on end, enabling groups or individuals to find their own space away from others and settle in for a half day or so. As this stretch of coast line is more exposed, it can be windier and experience higher waves, so it is well suited to wind sports and older families/groups. The car park is a few meters from the beach itself, so access is easy for most people and you can make several trips if you’re brining a lot of beach toys with you.
sources.shortName: The best beaches in Japan

sources.snippet: Perhaps a more conventional beach style, this wide strip of sand stretches for miles, groups or individuals can find their own place away from others and settle for about half a day. Since this part of the coast is more exposed, it can be windier and experience higher waves, making it ideal for wind sports and older families/groups. The parking lot is a few meters from the beach, so access is easy for most people and you can take several excursions if you bring a lot of beach toys.
sources.shortName: Gorgeous Beaches in Miyako-jima,Japan

sources.snippet: Prepare to be mesmerized by the sheer beauty of Yonaha Maehama Beach, a true gem nestled on Miyako Island. With its pristine white sands and breathtaking turquoise waters extending towards the distant Kurima Island, this beach is a testament to natural splendor and has rightfully earned the reputation as the most beautiful beach in the Far East.
sources.shortName: 10 Fun Things to Do in the Miyako Islands - Places to Go, Local Food & Sightseeing Tips for Miyakojima

sources.snippet: Yonaha-Maehama Beach is the seven kilometers of white sand coastline, and you can enjoy astonishing landscape. As its beautiful white sand is described as the most beautiful sand in the east, it is a perfect place to sun bathing and relax. Spending a relaxing time at Yonaha-Maehama Beach makes you feel like as if you were inside a post card.
sources.shortName: Top 10 Tourist Attractions & Best Things to Do in Miyako-jima Island, Okinawa

sources.snippet: Yonaha Maehama Beach is the most beautiful beach on Miyako Island or even the entire Okinawa!. The beach stretches about 7km southwest of the island and is formed with fine powder-snow-like white sand. With the sandy beach together and the highly transparent aqua ocean, no one spot at Yonaha Maehama Beach isn’t stunning.
sources.siteName: Vegetarian's Japan Guide | Ultimate Japan Guide, Vegetarian-Friendly, Hidden Gems in Japan
sources.shortName: The Complete Guide to the Beaches on Miyako-jima Island 2025

sources.snippet: Yonaha-Maehama BeachThis seven kilometer long stretch of white sand is often hailed as one of the best beaches in Japan. In addition to its cobalt blue waters, the shore also boasts many washrooms, shower facilities, and shops. Likewise, Yonaha-Maehama beach is also perfectly designed for play.
sources.shortName: Okinawa’s Isle of Miyakojima | Paradise in Southern Japan

sources.snippet: One of the most popular beaches on Miyako Island and one of the most beautiful beaches in Japan. A lot of tourists visit this place for sunning, swimming, wedding photo or beach sports. Maehama beach is not recommended for snorkeling to protect fishes on the beach.
sources.shortName: 6 Stunning Spots to Visit in Miyako Island, Okinawa!

sources.snippet: Miyako Island’s most famous beach is the 7-kilometer long Yonaha Maehama Beach, and it is especially great for relaxing and swimming. If you want to go snorkeling, Aragusuku Beach would be your best bet. For spotting turtles, Yoshino Beach is the place to go.
sources.shortName: Miyakojima Island | Okinawa Travel Guide

sources.snippet: Located on Miyakojima’s eastern coast, Aragusuku Beach (Map) is the perfect spot for snorkeling and sunbathing. Colorful sea life can be seen swimming in the beach’s clear aquamarine waters. If you’re lucky, you might even spot a sea turtle while snorkeling.
sources.shortName: Miyakojima - GaijinPot Travel

sources.snippet: Yonaha Maehama beach is located at the Southwest end of Miyako island. It is 7 km of white sand and was voted the best beach out of the top 10 beaches in Japan from 2013 to 2015. I you have a chance to visit Miyako island, you don`t want to miss this beach.
sources.shortName: Miyakojima! Recommended beach spots and surrounding islands. | GOOD LUCK TRIP

sources.snippet:
The sand that touches my feet 
Smooth and comfortable
, It is also called "the whitest in the Orient" 
Representing Miyakojima
Beach. [Okinawa Miyakojima] Beach photo on a sandy beach said to be the best in the Orient
sources.siteName: アクティビティジャパン
sources.shortName: [2024] When does the sea open on Miyakojima? Recommended beaches and activities | Activity Japan

sources.snippet: Miyako Island/2.5 hours Over 10 years of experience as a guide!. Beginners are welcome☆Beach Experience Diving Tour Recommended for those who get seasick... (No.843)開始時間9:30-12:00 / 13:00-15:30所要時間Approx.
sources.shortName: Miyako Island Beaches: Marine Adventures Await

sources.snippet: There is one beach on Miyako Island that is absolutely unforgettable, with its white sandy beaches, mild climate, and the flat, serene impression of the terrain and the kind people who live on it.
sources.shortName: 7 recommended beaches in Miyako Island, Okinawa! Forget about everyday life on one of Okinawa's most popular islands
A Quick Getaway to Dazzling Beaches of Miyakojima on New Direct Flights from Haneda

places.name: Yonaha Beach

reviews.text: Beautiful white sand beach, with a lot of space and turquoise sea water. Definitely a good spot pour the sunset. Probably the best beach in Miyakojima if your goal is to lay down and get your skin tanned a little.

There is only 8 places in this world which have this kind of pristine-torquoise waters: the Bahamas, Maldives, Palawan (the Philippines), Bora Bora, Zanzibar, Whitsundays Island (Australia), Turk and Caicos and, of course, Miyako-jima, Japan. And it is exactly Yonaha Maehama Beach that has this surreal waters. So beautiful. You can literally walk 100 meters into the middle of the sea and water level is still only at your ankle. Combining with the bridge on the left side, it really makes Yonaha Maehama Beach a true paradise on earth. And among the 8 places that offer pristine turquoise water, I dare to say that Miyako-jima and Yonaha Maehama in particular is the most peaceful and accessible one, as there are direct flights from big Japanese cities and the Airbus A321/Boeing 737 can easily land in the Miyako airport.

I think this is the best beach in this island! Often hailed as one of Japan's most beautiful beaches, it boasts over 7 kilometers of powdery white sand and turquoise waters, ideal for swimming and sunbathing. We did 2 days here because it was amazing! Can spot also many fishes!

places.generalDescription: Nestled on the southern coast of Miyako Island, Imgyaa Marine Garden is a hidden gem that offers a unique blend of natural beauty and adventure. This serene spot features calm, rocky coves ideal for snorkeling, where vibrant marine life thrives among colorful corals. The area boasts an inviting seafront trail leading to an observation deck adorned with a quirky cow statue, providing stunning views of the surrounding landscape.

sources.snippet: This is a spot that combines elements of a terrace where you can enjoy the ocean rather than a so-called beach where the beach and the ocean are connected to each other on the ground. The natural, cove-like topography of the island makes it a rare space on Miyako Island where visitors can enjoy the dynamic nature and view a special landscape that can only be experienced here. Of course, being a beach, it is possible to actually step into the ocean and swim.
sources.shortName: 7 recommended beaches in Miyako Island, Okinawa! Forget about everyday life on one of Okinawa's most popular islands

sources.snippet: Well-protected from the large waves that sometimes roll in from Miyakojima’s southern coast, Imgya Marine Garden is a great place to go snorkeling almost every day. The inlet is surrounded by green hills from where you have a nice view, and the water around the bridge area is clear and at a nice depth for snorkeling (around 3-4 meters). There are many soft and hard corals and the area is teeming with sea life.
sources.shortName: The 5 best places to go in Miyakojima

sources.snippet: Imgya Marine Garden is a small, protected area of water (almost like a natural harbor) and is ideal for snorkeling – especially for beginners. There are also some beautiful walking trails which can be enjoyed here. The location can be a little tricky to find – there are two beaches with this name.
sources.shortName: Beaches of Miyakojima (comprehensive list)

sources.snippet: Imugya Marine Garden is a seaside park by the natural rocky cove. While the beach isn’t very large, it is calm and perfect for children to swim in. It is also another beach on Miyako Island that is popular for snorkeling.
sources.siteName: Vegetarian's Japan Guide | Ultimate Japan Guide, Vegetarian-Friendly, Hidden Gems in Japan
sources.shortName: The Complete Guide to the Beaches on Miyako-jima Island 2025

places.name: Imgyaa Marine Garden

reviews.text:
A beautiful place to stroll for an hour. Enjoy the winding pathways around the bay that lead to a beautiful ocean lookout.

If you have your swimsuit you can hop n the water and enjoy tropical fish. The water is very clear!

Parking is free and the viewpoints are definitely worth a camera stop!
Beautiful place with beaches and paths around the whole area.

We went on a cloudy and windy day but it was still worth the trip.

A lot of people paddle boarding and snorkeling because the water is protected and more calm here.

places.generalDescription: Miyako-jima, the largest of the Miyako Islands in Okinawa Prefecture, is a scenic island known for its coral reef and stunning beaches perfect for swimming, sunbathing, and snorkeling. Visitors can enjoy a panoramic drive around Miyako-jima and neighboring islands with frequent stops at natural attractions offering breathtaking water views.

sources.snippet: No lifeguards are stationed at most of Miyako Island’s beaches. The only two beaches on the island with lifeguards stationed are Yonaha Maehama Beach at the island’s southwest and Shigira Beach at Miyako-jima’s south. So if you plan to enjoy the beaches and even water sports, try to go with others and watch out for rips.
sources.siteName: Vegetarian's Japan Guide | Ultimate Japan Guide, Vegetarian-Friendly, Hidden Gems in Japan
sources.shortName: The Complete Guide to the Beaches on Miyako-jima Island 2025

places.name: Miyako-jima

reviews.text: Miyakojima my favorite place in the world.the best spot ever.

Miyakojima is one of my favorite Island in Okinawa.
Highly recommended.

Everywhere in Japan has something special because Japan is a special country Miyako-Jima is one of special places that you need to visit if you ever had the chance because you will never regret it , good luck .

places.generalDescription: Sunset Beach, located near the vibrant American Village in Chatan, Okinawa, is a must-visit for sunset enthusiasts. This lively beach offers not only stunning views of the sun dipping below the horizon but also a range of activities to enjoy throughout the day. With its spacious shoreline and scenic promenade facing west, it’s an ideal spot for relaxation and recreation.

sources.snippet: With a stunning view of Irabu Bridge, Sunset Beach just outside Hirara city, is the perfect place to view the sun set into the sea. Come here just before sunset to enjoy a last swim of the day, before watching the sunset from the beach. Facilities: Showers, Toilets, Parking.
sources.shortName: Beaches of Miyakojima (comprehensive list)

places.name: Sunset beach

reviews.text: Nice place to spend hours, not many people come to swim. Very clean and calm. You can shower at the bathroom area.
With all respect, this one should not even be called a "beach" as it is obviously not possible to swim here while the sand is black and hard.

There are restrooms which close at 19/19.30.
There are vending machines for beverages. The beach is not "into the wild" but the view is nice!

places.generalDescription: Sunayama Beach is a picturesque cove on Miyako Island, featuring white sand and turquoise waters. The beach is easily accessible from downtown Miyako, with hotels, restaurants, and souvenir stores nearby. It stretches for about 360 meters and offers amenities such as parking, showers, and toilets. Visitors can enjoy the stunning sunset over Irabu Island from this popular spot.

sources.snippet: Sunayama Beach is one of Miyakojima’s most famous beaches and is chosen as the best beach in Japan three years in a row. After ascending a narrow path of a sandy mountain, it opens to a breathtaking view of the powdery white sand and transparent waters that are so clear that you could see through the bottom. Sunayama Beach is a famous and popular beach for locals and tourist, yet it is surprisingly quiet and never crowded.
sources.shortName: Top 10 Tourist Attractions & Best Things to Do in Miyako-jima Island, Okinawa

sources.snippet: 1.Sunayama Beach Straight out of a luxury travel brochure, Sunayama Beach is your ultimate desert island paradise. Turquoise water laps the fine white sands, and at mid to low tide it stays shallow for a long time, making it a great spot to take the kids as well. The beach is small and entirely un-commercial, tucked in a small natural bay.
sources.shortName: 5 best beaches on Miyako-jima, Japan

sources.snippet: Straight out of a luxury travel brochure, Sunayama Beach is your ultimate desert island paradise. Turquoise water laps the fine white sands, and at mid to low tide it stays shallow for a long time, making it a great spot to take the kids as well. The beach is small and entirely un-commercial, tucked in a small natural bay.
sources.shortName: The best beaches in Japan

sources.snippet: This beautiful white beach, with it’s crystal blue water, takes its name from the sand dune “mountain” which is also found here. There is a fascinating “gate cliff” on the beach, which gives it a unique look. Sunayama beach on the northern part of the island is no secret location, and is well-visited all season.
sources.shortName: Beaches of Miyakojima (comprehensive list)

sources.snippet: This last beach is also located in a relatively accessible location, about 20 minutes by car from Miyakojima Airport. One point to note is that it takes some time to walk from the parking lot to the beach, which is often physically demanding. But even beyond that, it also has an appeal that beckons people in.
sources.shortName: 7 recommended beaches in Miyako Island, Okinawa! Forget about everyday life on one of Okinawa's most popular islands

sources.snippet: Sunayama Beach is your ultimate island paradise, straight from a luxury travel brochure. Turquoise water surrounds the white sand, and at low tide it stays flat for a long time, making it a great place to take children. The beach is small and totally non-commercial, hidden in a small natural cove.
sources.shortName: Gorgeous Beaches in Miyako-jima,Japan

sources.snippet: 4 kilometers North from the heart of the Hirara city, lies Sunayama Beach. The white powder-like sand, beautiful sea and the naturally formed arch-shaped rock, remind you of nature’s unmatched beauty. From the parking lot to the beach, you must ascend and descend the white sand dunes.
sources.shortName: Miyakojima! Recommended beach spots and surrounding islands. | GOOD LUCK TRIP

sources.snippet: Sunayama BeachThis secluded cove is located to the north of Miyakojima’s main isle. Boasting a natural limestone arch, this spot is one of the area’s most iconic attractions. Despite its unforgettable beauty though, Sunayama Beach’s powdery white sands are rarely ever crowded.
sources.shortName: Okinawa’s Isle of Miyakojima | Paradise in Southern Japan

sources.snippet: On the north of Miyako-jima Island, Sunayama Beach is known for the coral reef arch at the southern end. The white sand at this pleasant compacted beach is also very fine, making it really comfortable to walk on. Of course, the coral reef didn’t initially have a hole.
sources.siteName: Vegetarian's Japan Guide | Ultimate Japan Guide, Vegetarian-Friendly, Hidden Gems in Japan
sources.shortName: The Complete Guide to the Beaches on Miyako-jima Island 2025

sources.snippet: On the top of the hill, you can see the beautiful scenery of the blue ocean and sand. Each beach in Miyako has a different sand texture and color which is very interesting and difficult to find anywhere else. Sunayama beach also has an arch of natural rock.
sources.shortName: 6 Stunning Spots to Visit in Miyako Island, Okinawa!

sources.snippet:
cobalt blue sea
And a cave on the sandy beach, a beach with impressive white sand dunes. Close to downtown
, access is also convenient. At a spot that represents Miyakojima,
Often published in guidebooks, etc.
sources.siteName: アクティビティジャパン
sources.shortName: [2024] When does the sea open on Miyakojima? Recommended beaches and activities | Activity Japan

sources.snippet: Miyako Island/2.5 hours Over 10 years of experience as a guide!. Beginners are welcome☆Beach Experience Diving Tour Recommended for those who get seasick... (No.843)開始時間9:30-12:00 / 13:00-15:30所要時間Approx.
sources.shortName: Miyako Island Beaches: Marine Adventures Await
Luscious Beaches and Juicy Bananas at Miyakojima, Okinawa

places.name: Sunayama beach

reviews.text:
This is an amazing beach – truly a hidden gem!
The sea is beautifully blue with stunning gradients, and the natural surroundings are breathtaking, with rocks and cliffs lining the shore. The sand is soft and clean!
Not many people come here often, which is why the beach remains so pristine.
One of the best beaches in Miyakojima!
Highly recommended!
🏝️✨🌊⛰️💙

Sunayama Beach is a stunning spot known for its soft white sands and crystal-clear waters. Its infinite shallow water area makes it perfect for wading and relaxing. The iconic natural rock arch adds a unique charm, making it great for photos and peaceful strolls. It's an ideal place to soak up the sun and enjoy serene ocean views away from the crowds.

The beach is clean now, there is white sand and the water is not too deep, which allow travellers to reach about 20 meters into the sea with water level only equals their belly. But there is no beach chairs, toilet or shops in the beach, which can be uncomfortable if you want to stay there for long. Still, a very beautiful place and deserved at least a quick stop to take some photos.

places.generalDescription: Sawata no Hama is a captivating beach located near Shimojishima Airport, characterized by its unique expanse of sand interspersed with boulders that were left behind by a tsunami in 1771. This tranquil spot features shallow waters that fluctuate with the tides, creating an ever-changing landscape.
places.name: SAWATA NO HAMA

reviews.text:
Site Name: Sawada-no Hama Alternative Name:
In the shire of Sawada hamlet close to Shimoji-Jima Airport, numerous rocks are rolling. These are believed to be drifted from the sea by the tsunami in 1771, just like "Obi-iwa" rock on the western shore of the neighboring Shimoji-Jima Island. Sunset probably very good view here. Low tide you can view the lots of interesting rocks. And you can also see 17END at this location. Very nice place.
Sunset probably very good here. Low tide is interesting as lots of unusual rock formations. Too much seaweed in the sea for me to swim. Also very shallow.

Google has the wrong name.  It's Sawadanohama (Sawada Beach).  Wrong name aside, it's still a great beach.  It's very safe and has shallow water for a very long ways.  Great for kids and BBQs!  Watching the sunset with a bonfire is probably the best way to enjoy this beach.

places.generalDescription: Nestled just a short drive from Kurima Bridge, Nagamahama Beach is a hidden gem on Kurimajima Island, known for its stunningly soft and pristine white sands that stretch for about 1 kilometer. This tranquil beach offers an escape from the hustle and bustle, making it ideal for those seeking solitude amidst nature. With its secluded entrance through lush vegetation, visitors are greeted by breathtaking ocean views as they step onto the sand.

sources.snippet: Located southwest of the Miyako mainland and just across the serene Yonaha Maehama Beach, lies the charming Kurimajima Island, easily accessible via the Kurima Bridge. This small island, predominantly dedicated to agriculture, offers visitors a delightful escape with its breathtaking ocean views and unique attractions.
sources.shortName: 10 Fun Things to Do in the Miyako Islands - Places to Go, Local Food & Sightseeing Tips for Miyakojima

sources.snippet: Nagamahama Beach is located on the western side of Kurima Island. It is a remote beach where you are very likely to have it all to yourself. This is probably one of the most overlooked beaches in the Miyako Islands.
sources.shortName: Beaches of Miyakojima (comprehensive list)

places.name: Nagamahama beach

reviews.text:
Best beach to swim!!!
It was a rainy day, but without waves
We were alone on the beach, perfect water temperature, beautiful colors, quiet, the nature is just amazing
Absolutely stunningly clear and warm ocean water. Incredible experience with the family here. Highly recommended.
This is an awesome place for quiet, out-of-the-way, far-from-the-crowd swimming and snorkeling.  Honestly, I shouldn't even post about it, it's so beautiful.

places.generalDescription: Toguchinohama beach is a serene and private spot with scattered figures, offering a tranquil and calming atmosphere. The soft sand and soothing waves make it an ideal place for relaxation. Visitors are captivated by the stunning scenery, often finding it hard to put into words. It's considered one of the best beaches in Miyakojima, with its beautiful ocean views and a nearby restaurant providing a great dining experience.

sources.snippet: crossing the Irabu Ohashi and proceeding along the coast to the west, you will eventually reach Toguchinohama Beach. With a width of 50m and the length of 800m, the white sand here is so fine that walking barefoot has never felt so pleasant.
sources.shortName: Miyakojima! Recommended beach spots and surrounding islands. | GOOD LUCK TRIP

places.name: Toguchinohama beach

reviews.text:
What a beautiful beach. The water is very clear love to swim and relaxing. The sand was very soft and beautiful place. The parking lot was limited only and has a coin shower facilities next to the toilet 100 yen for 4 minutes only.

Available for rent :
big umbrella 1500yen.
Towel
Small boat
Swim ring inflatable

Beautiful beach with pristine clear waters and white sand, they have a car park and some coffee stores/vending machine next to the beach, so every refueling demand from travellers should be well met. These are spots to take some epic photos as well. To reach Toguchi-no-hama you will also have to cross the Irabuohashi Bridge, which is a great experience itself. The only small minus point is the beach is a bit short and there are only few beach chairs there. Still, it is definitely worth to spend an afternoon at this beach.
It was beautiful and definitely not crowded. We saw a few surfers and had plenty of room in the water without worrying about others. The parking was pretty good as well.

places.generalDescription: Funakusu Beach, located on Ikema island, offers a serene and secluded setting for a day of beach relaxation. The beach is not widely known to tourists, making it an ideal spot for those seeking a peaceful escape. While the beach may not be very wide, its uncrowded nature provides the perfect atmosphere for unwinding. Snorkeling enthusiasts will find delight in the beautiful reef just offshore, though caution is advised due to potential currents.

sources.snippet: This beautiful beach on Ikema island is a great snorkeling spot, and isn’t overrun by tourists. If you want a relaxed day at a remote beach, then grab your beach gear and head to the north of Ikema island. Facilities: Toilets, Parking.
sources.shortName: Beaches of Miyakojima (comprehensive list)

places.name: Funakusu Beach

reviews.text: There are free parking spaces available near the restrooms 🚻. The entrance can be a bit tricky to locate, but once you find it, it's just a one-minute walk to the beautiful, light-blue ocean.

The beach is rather small and not crowded which is a plus. Besides the overall look of the beach and ocean are incredible. However, this was the beach with the most garbage during our time on Miyakojima. For the plastic it is of course hard to tell, what comes from the ocean and what was thrown away right there. However, we also found a lot of freshly broken glass containers at the beach and in the water. While snorkeling we also saw a tire among glass and plastic. So sad!
Another sad thing was an Asian tourist, who repeadedly stood on the corals so that he could check pictures on his device that he had taken while snorkeling. Some humans seem not to care at all!
There was no shower and a lot of dead coral and trash. However if you swim out far enough you can find a lot of tropical fish. I recommend a detour for this place.

places.generalDescription: Irabu Island is a picturesque destination connected to Miyako Island by the longest toll-free bridge in Japan, the 3,540-meter Irabu Bridge. The island boasts a fisherman's town and pristine white sand beaches. At its highest point stands the Makiyama Observatory, offering panoramic views of Miyako Island and the impressive bridge. Iraph Sui, a Luxury Collection Hotel on Irabu Island, provides a tranquil seaside retreat with minimalist yet plush accommodations.

sources.snippet: crossing the Irabu Ohashi and proceeding along the coast to the west, you will eventually reach Toguchinohama Beach. With a width of 50m and the length of 800m, the white sand here is so fine that walking barefoot has never felt so pleasant.
sources.shortName: Miyakojima! Recommended beach spots and surrounding islands. | GOOD LUCK TRIP

sources.snippet: For those who prefer to stay above the water, stand-up paddleboarding (SUP) and kayaking are excellent options. These activities allow you to explore the island's coastal areas at a leisurely pace, providing both exercise and relaxation.
sources.shortName: Miyako Island Beaches: Marine Adventures Await

sources.snippet: Connecting Miyako and Irabu Islands, this architectural marvel not only serves as a convenient passage but also offers an awe-inspiring experience that should not be missed.
sources.shortName: 10 Fun Things to Do in the Miyako Islands - Places to Go, Local Food & Sightseeing Tips for Miyakojima

sources.snippet: There are also bridges that connect to the neighbouring islands of Irabu, Ikema, and Kurima, which are likewise lined by heavenly beaches.
sources.shortName: Miyakojima, a Tropical Paradise

places.name: Irabu Island

reviews.text: Great day for a biking trip around the island
Stunning ! So clean, so blue, so nice and so relaxing

Pretty ugly ngl.

And a crab pinched off my toe

places.generalDescription: Yoshino Kaigan Beach, situated on the east coast of Miyako Island, is a popular destination for snorkeling enthusiasts. The beach boasts colorful coral reefs and an array of tropical fish, making it an ideal spot for beginners and families with children. Visitors may also have the chance to witness sea turtles laying eggs during certain times of the year. Additionally, Boraga Beach nearby offers opportunities for snorkeling and sea kayaking, while featuring a mysterious limestone cave with impressive stalactite formations.

sources.snippet: If you’re seeking a bit more of an adventure, why not give snorkeling in the crystal clear waters of Miyakojima a try. There are two great beaches to enjoy an unforgettable snorkeling experience. Aragusuku Beach (新城海岸), with its shallow water, has become a popular spot for visitors who are looking to enjoy some sea bathing and snorkeling.
sources.shortName: 6 Best Things To Do On Miyakojima Island, Okinawa

sources.siteName: アクティビティジャパン
sources.shortName: [2024] When does the sea open on Miyakojima? Recommended beaches and activities | Activity Japan

sources.snippet: Traveling further southeast from Aragusuku Beach, Yoshino Kaigan Beach is another beach on Miyako-jima Island that is perfect for snorkeling. As soon as you enter the highly transparent sea, the colorful coral reefs will be right in front of you. As you swim, various types of tropical fish may surround you!
sources.siteName: Vegetarian's Japan Guide | Ultimate Japan Guide, Vegetarian-Friendly, Hidden Gems in Japan
sources.shortName: The Complete Guide to the Beaches on Miyako-jima Island 2025

sources.snippet: Other attractions at the cape include snorkeling and sea kayaking at Boraga Beach (Map) and Yoshino Beach (Map), two of the best beaches in Miyakojima to see coral and tropical fish. Boraga Beach is also home to a mysterious limestone cave with extraordinary stalactite formations.
sources.shortName: Miyakojima - GaijinPot Travel

sources.snippet: Standing on the beach and paddling about is all well and good, but to see some of Miyakojima’s best sights you’ll need to get more than just your feet wet.
sources.shortName: Miyakojima: What to Do and Where to Stay on Japan’s Most Beautiful Island

sources.snippet: Please respect the turtles’ space, as they are very sensitive animals. You can see a beautiful sunset from Yonaha Maehama Beach and Aragusuku Beach.
sources.shortName: Miyakojima Island | Okinawa Travel Guide

places.name: Yoshino Kaigan Beach

reviews.text:
Many fish and corals
There are parking spaces, shower facilities and shuttle bus to the beach for 2000 yen
Good place for scuba diving
Will come again

“Very friendly fishes” had to pay a 1000 for parking but you have included shuttle bus and showers and changing room.
Beach is nice but of trash here and there but for snorkelling is the best! I was just literally few meters from the beach and the fishes started to come around me! Many species! Very recommended to come here! Many families as well!
The water is very clear and many fishes can be seen.  Great for snorkeling.  Snorkeling gears are available for rent.  ¥500 parking fee and you can enjoy shuttle service and shower facilities.

places.generalDescription: Shigira Beach, located on Miyako Island in Japan, is a popular destination for swimming and snorkeling, offering the chance to encounter sea turtles in their natural habitat. The beach area provides rental umbrellas for visitors' convenience. Situated within the expansive Shigira Resort, the beach is part of a larger leisure complex that includes hotels, golf courses, onsens (hot springs), restaurants, and souvenir stores. The resort caters to various budgets with a range of accommodation options.

sources.snippet: If you head south to The main island of Miyakojima, you’ll experience an urban sprawl of Shigira Resorts, which has properties, golf courses, and beaches. Aimed at discerning travelers — though with a few options for the more budget-conscious — the beaches are available for public use as well as hotel guests. Shigira Beach is another bay with white sand and turquoise waters that become a separate body of water at low tide.
sources.shortName: Gorgeous Beaches in Miyako-jima,Japan

sources.snippet: Shigira Beach Heading south on Miyakojima’s main island you will come across a sprawl of Shigira Resorts owned and operated properties, golf courses, and beaches. Geared towards the discerning traveller – though with some options for the more budget conscious – the beaches are for public use as well as hotel guests. Shigira Beach is another white sand, turquoise water bay that becomes a separate body of water at low tide.
sources.shortName: 5 best beaches on Miyako-jima, Japan

sources.snippet: Heading south on Miyakojima’s main island you will come across a sprawl of Shigira Resorts owned and operated properties, golf courses, and beaches. Geared towards the discerning traveller – though with some options for the more budget conscious – the beaches are for public use as well as hotel guests. Shigira Beach is another white sand, turquoise water bay that becomes a separate body of water at low tide.
sources.shortName: The best beaches in Japan

sources.snippet: Shigira Beach is a beach located in Shigira Resort at Miyako-jima Island‘s south end. The beach is known as the spot where you can swim with sea turtles more than 80% of the time. Because of its bay shape, the waves are relatively calm, making it a great spot for kayaking, SUP, and SUP yoga.
sources.siteName: Vegetarian's Japan Guide | Ultimate Japan Guide, Vegetarian-Friendly, Hidden Gems in Japan
sources.shortName: The Complete Guide to the Beaches on Miyako-jima Island 2025

sources.snippet: Shigira Beach on the south side of the island is one of the best for snorkelling, especially for sea turtle fans. Snorkelers and divers should also check out Yoshino Beach for its fantastic coral reefs close to land.
sources.shortName: Miyakojima: What to Do and Where to Stay on Japan’s Most Beautiful Island

sources.shortName: [2024] When does the sea open on Miyakojima? Recommended beaches and activities | Activity Japan

places.name: Shigira Beach

reviews.text:
Shigira Beach is a stunning destination for diving and snorkeling enthusiasts. The vibrant coral reefs are teeming with life, showcasing a variety of colorful tropical fish and the chance to swim alongside graceful sea turtles. The water clarity is exceptional, making it easy to appreciate the underwater beauty.
During my visit, I was amazed by the diversity of marine life: corals and turtles. Overall, Shigira Beach is a must-visit spot for anyone looking to explore the wonders of the ocean!

Beautiful beach with easy, shallow entry, clear water, beautiful colors. We spent two day. Here and hav the best of fun. You can swim few hundred meters to man made rest place, you can snorkel and see turtles and many fishes. Just gorgeous

A beautiful white sand beach and lagoon with calm and shallow water. Coral reefs are very lively and beautiful, you can see many kinds of tropical fish and sea creatures including clown fish, sea urchin, see snake, angelfish, lagoon triggerfish, etc. The water is not as clear as other crystal clear beaches in Miyako, but it's clear enough to see the sea creatures. It's worth visiting as you can enjoy schools of beautiful fish in tranquil bay. Many snorkeling tours start from this beach. My 5yo and 4yo enjoyed snorkeling here too. You might be able to see sea turtles too (according to the hotel concierge there are 3 to 4 turtles around in the bay) .
You can rent snorkel gears at the beach house. Otherwise make sure to bring your own snorkel and safety systems including life jacket and reef shoes.
Be aware of the tide conditions and timings, when I visit there in July I was told by the hotel concierge that you need to snorkel in the morning not the afternoon.
Conveniently located for those who stay at the Shigira Beach Resort. Those who come by car need to pay parking fee.

places.generalDescription: Pina Gama Beach is a stunning coastal destination with golden sands and crystal-clear waters. It's known for its picturesque setting, perfect for relaxation and water activities. The beach offers a serene atmosphere, making it an ideal spot for sunbathing and enjoying the natural beauty. Visitors can also explore the nearby cliffs and rock formations, adding an adventurous touch to their beach experience.

sources.snippet: The name comes from the Miyako Island dialect where "Pai "means south and "Nagama "means long beach. In other words, it is a big bee in the tropics, and this one has created a wonderful space that lives up to its name. This beach is popular with men and women of all ages, as it has a very gentle and serene atmosphere with the ocean and sun of Okinawa.
sources.shortName: 7 recommended beaches in Miyako Island, Okinawa! Forget about everyday life on one of Okinawa's most popular islands

sources.snippet: Painagama beach is located conveniently close to the city of Hirara. While it isn’t the most beautiful of all the beaches in Miyakojima, it is very practical if you live in the city. There is a swimming area which is equipped with nets to protect swimmers from poisonous jellyfish.
sources.shortName: Beaches of Miyakojima (comprehensive list)

sources.snippet: Painagama Beach is a lot closer to the island’s town center. The beach that is within walking distance from Nishizato Ōdōri Street (西里大通り) is also known as a barrier-free beach equipped with an ambulant toilet and shower facility. The waves at Painagama Beach are calm.
sources.siteName: Vegetarian's Japan Guide | Ultimate Japan Guide, Vegetarian-Friendly, Hidden Gems in Japan
sources.shortName: The Complete Guide to the Beaches on Miyako-jima Island 2025

sources.snippet: Painagama Beach is accessible by walk from a town and is popular among families with children. The beach offers a netted area for swimming and has a safe and clean beach. It is a perfect place to swim in the transparent water or to relax on the beach.
sources.shortName: Top 10 Tourist Attractions & Best Things to Do in Miyako-jima Island, Okinawa

places.name: Pai Nagama Beach

reviews.text: The locals swimming beach with delineated floats it's perfectly safe. Great for kids or just a quick swim. Easy access with toilet and showers. It's not a super beach but functional for ocean swimming.  Very local!

Quiet, clean and calm beach in the city. Very close from nishizato market. Not much to see but good to go for an evening walk. The water is clear and comfortable to swim in. Especially the kids. Safe beach.
Smaller beach in the city where if you are lucky (we were not) you should catch an amazing sunset.
